adverb.description: Used to emphasize a statement or response confirming something already suggested.
examples: it was not expected to last long, and indeed it took less than three weeks
“She should have no trouble hearing him.” “No indeed.”

adverb.description: Used to introduce a further and stronger or more surprising point.
examples: the idea is attractive to many men and indeed to many women

adverb.description: Used in a response to express interest, incredulity, or contempt.
examples: Nice boys, indeed—they were going to smash his head in!

origin: Middle English: originally as in deed.
